long_desc.thetext:
Add an option that allows to disable "#:" (location) system comments in entries of .po files. These comments are used to enumerate the location(s) of a msgid. Example:
#: qx/test/locale/Locale.js:72 qx/test/locale/Locale.js:75 #: qx/test/locale/Locale.js:78 msgid "test One car" msgid_plural "test %1 cars" msgstr[0] "" msgstr[1] ""
The problem with these comments is that they change frequently when source lines are inserted or deleted, but they do not reflect actual changes to translation keys or their translations. Thus, these essential changes are blurred, e.g. in version control.
Corresponds to the xgettext option "--no-locations".

New config option "translate/poentry-with-occurrences" (default "true"); set to "false" to disable location comments.
Fixed with r20239.

Just a remark: when properly configuring your po editor (e.g. KBabel), you'll be able to display the corresponding source code section for each translatable string. This can be quite a handy feature when you need to determine the context of a translation from within the source code (particularly from the inline or JSDoc comments).
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
